Junior Internal Control Officer Job at Neveah Limited




        
    

        
        Neveah Limited is a leading commodity trading company established in 2014, with its head office in Abuja and five operational offices across Nigeria. The company specializes in the export of solid minerals and agricultural products, sourcing the finest raw materials from local markets to meet international demand. Neveah has now expanded into manufacturing, focusing on the recycling of aluminum and copper to produce ingots for export, further strengthening its global footprint.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Junior Internal Control Officer
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Mowe, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time
Department / Unit: Internal Control & Audit
Directly Reports to: Internal Control Manager, MD/CEO
Internal Interactions: Finance, Operations, Procurement

Role Overview


	Support the design and execution of internal control tests to safeguard assets and ensure compliance.


Key Responsibilities


	Perform control self?assessments and walkthroughs.
	Document process flows, risk-control matrices, and narratives.
	Test key controls and report exceptions.
	Track remediation plans and follow up on audit recommendations.


SMART KPIs


	Test Coverage: Achieve 100% testing of high?risk controls quarterly.
	Issue Closure: Close ≥90% of control deficiencies within agreed timelines.
	Report Turnaround: Deliver audit reports within 10 business days of fieldwork.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	3 years of internal audit/control experience, including 2 in manufacturing.


Skills & Competencies:


	Knowledge of COSO or ISO 31000 frameworks.
	Strong analytical and report-writing skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV saved in their full name to: careers@neveah.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only properly submitted applications and qualified candidates will be considered.

title: Job Openings at Troop Pharmaceuticals Limited
content:
Troop Pharmaceuticals Limited is a pharmaceutical company that focuses on Manufacturing and Community Pharmacy.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Pharmacist Assistant

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a  competent and driven Pharmacist Assistant with a background in Pharmacology or Pharmacy Technology to join our retail and clinical operations team.
	This role goes beyond support — the successful candidate will play an active role in consulting patients, dispensing medications, and contributing to the delivery of safe, efficient, and customer-focused pharmaceutical care.


Key Responsibilities


	Dispense prescription and over-the-counter medications accurately and efficiently, ensuring proper dosage, labeling, and patient education.
	Provide medication counselling and basic health consultations to patients on the appropriate use, storage, and side effects of their medications.
	Assist in reviewing prescriptions to ensure legal compliance, appropriateness of therapy, and avoidance of drug interactions.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient medication records and ensure all data is properly documented.
	Collaborate with the inventory team to monitor stock levels, restock medications, and manage expiries.
	Uphold regulatory and ethical standards in all dispensing and customer care activities.
	Provide health and wellness advice to walk-in clients and support over-the-counter product recommendations.
	Stay informed on new medications, guidelines, and best practices in pharmacy operations and patient safety.


Requirements


	OND / HND / B.Sc. in Pharmacology, Pharmacy Technician Studies, or related field.
	Minimum of 2 year of experience in a community pharmacy or clinical healthcare setting is preferred.
	Solid understanding of pharmaceutical formulations, pharmacokinetics, and common drug interactions.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a strong sense of empathy and professionalism.
	Ability to work independently, multitask, and manage patient inquiries effectively.
	Familiarity with pharmacy management software and inventory systems is an advantage.


What We Offer


	A collaborative, growth-oriented work environment.
	Hands-on experience in clinical and retail pharmacy operations.
	Opportunities for training and career advancement.
	Competitive salary and employee wellness support.


Application Closing Date: 11th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application to: simon_emeje@yahoo.com using Pharmacist Assistant as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Sales Representative / Logistics Officer

Job Location: Isolo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a proactive and goal-driven Sales Representative/Logistics Officer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving product sales, building strong customer relationships, and coordinating day-to-day logistics and supply chain activities.


Key Responsibilities


	Actively promote and sell Troop Pharmaceuticals’ products to existing and potential customers.
	Identify and develop new sales opportunities within assigned territories.
	Build and maintain strong customer relationships to drive customer satisfaction and loyalty.
	Process customer orders and ensure timely delivery of products.
	Manage inventory levels and coordinate product movement from warehouse to clients.
	Track and report on sales performance, market trends, and customer feedback.
	Collaborate with the logistics team to ensure smooth distribution and delivery processes.
	Resolve logistics issues and work closely with suppliers and delivery partners to optimize supply chain efficiency.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Logistics, or related field.
	Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in sales or logistics, preferably in the pharmaceutical or FMCG sector.
	Strong sales skills with proven ability to meet or exceed targets.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Good organizational and time management abilities.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office and basic logistics software.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
	Must be able to drive.


Application Closing Date: 11th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: simon_emeje@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Account  / Inventory Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Key Responsibilities
Accounting Duties:


	Record daily sales, purchases, expenses, and payment transactions.
	Prepare and submit daily, weekly, and monthly sales and financial reports.
	Manage accounts receivable and accounts payable, ensuring timely follow-up on payments.
	Conduct bank reconciliations and ensure proper documentation of all financial transactions.
	Assist with budget preparation, financial forecasting, and variance analysis.
	Ensure compliance with accounting standards, company policies, and regulatory requirements.
	Support audit processes and liaise with external auditors and tax consultants.


Inventory Management Duties:


	Monitor and maintain accurate stock levels across all branches and warehouses.
	Conduct regular stock counts and reconcile physical stock with inventory records.
	Track and record stock movements, including purchases, transfers, and sales.
	Identify discrepancies between physical counts and system records and resolve variances.
	Work closely with sales and procurement teams to ensure accurate inventory forecasting.
	Prepare periodic inventory reports for management review.
	Implement and maintain inventory control procedures to minimize stock losses and expiries.


General Duties:


	Ensure all financial and inventory records are properly filed and easily accessible.
	Collaborate with branch teams and sales representatives to ensure accountability.
	Provide management with timely and accurate reports to support decision-making.
	Recommend process improvements to strengthen internal controls and efficiency.
	Perform other related duties as assigned by the Head of Corporate Services.


Key Requirements


	HND / Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field.
	2 - 3 years of experience in accounting and/or inventory management, preferably in the pharmaceutical or FMCG sector.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage) and inventory management systems.
	Strong attention to detail, with a high level of accuracy and integrity.
	Good knowledge of inventory control procedures and financial reporting.
	Strong organizational and analytical skills.
	Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
	Ability to multitask and work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.


Application Closing Date: 3rd August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@troopharm.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at Cen Global Services Limited
content:
Cen Global Services Limited (“Cen Global”) is proudly a Nigerian registered company with broad specialization in Shipping & Marine, Recruitment & Manpower Supply, Procurement & Engineering Services, and Consultancy Services. Cen Global was incorporated in March, 2010.

Our business sustainable approach is to understand the needs of our clients and subsequently create a uniquely structured service process tailored towards meeting or exceeding expectations.
Our Corporate Head office is located in Port Harcourt, Rivers State, Nigeria but we have developed a robust network around the country to effectively deliver products and services across Nigeria at a very short notice

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



1.) Air Conditioning Technician

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a skilled and versatile HVAC Technician to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will possess a high level of expertise in both residential and industrial HVAC systems, be able to troubleshoot complex issues, and ensure efficient system performance.
	A strong work ethic, customer-oriented attitude, and the ability to work independently or as part of a team are essential.


Responsibilities


	Install, inspect, and maintain HVAC systems.
	Diagnose and repair HVAC systems, ensuring minimal downtime and optimal performance.
	Fabricate, install, and repair ductwork and piping
	Perform routine inspections and maintenance


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE or its equivalence
	Minimum of 2 years of experience as an HVAC Technician
	Strong knowledge of HVAC systems including duct systems, and refrigeration.
	Ability to read and interpret blueprints, schematics, and technical manuals.
	Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
	Physical ability to lift heavy equipment, work in confined spaces, and work at heights.


Application Closing Date: 31st July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resumes to: careers@cenglobalservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Accountant

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Accountant to join their team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in accounting and financial management, with a minimum of five (5) years’ post-qualification experience in an accounting role.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage all accounting operations
	Prepare financial statements, budgets, and ensure compliance with relevant regulations and accounting standards
	Ensure timely and accurate tax computations and remittances (VAT, PAYE, WHT, etc.)
	Coordinate audits and liaise with internal and external auditors
	Ensure compliance with all financial policies, procedures, and reporting requirements
	Maintain and update financial records and documentation


Requirements


	Must be a Chartered Accountant (ACA)
	Minimum of 5 years of work experience in accounting
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian tax laws and financial regulations
	Excellent organizational and communication skills.


Application Closing Date: 23rd July, 2025. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their resumes to: careers@cenglobalservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Health Safety Environment Officer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a suitable candidate for the role of a HSE Officer to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for implementing HSE policies and procedures, training employees on safety practices, and ensuring full compliance with regulatory requirements.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement health, safety, and environmental policies and procedures.
	Ensure the use of proper personal protective equipment (PPE) and enforce safety rules.
	Train employees and contractors on HSE awareness, emergency response, and safe work practices.
	Promote a safety culture throughout the organization through engagement and communication.
	Maintain HSE records.


Requirements


	B. Sc. or HND in Environmental Science, Engineering, or a related field.
	0 - 2 years of experience in a similar role.
	Good knowledge of relevant HSE laws and regulations.


Application Closing Date: 11th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resumes to: careers@cenglobalservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
